reviews.text: Great BBQ at this place. Corn bread was just okay but everything else was delicious. I had pulled pork and my wife had the ribs. Fast and friendly service as well, my wife asked if she could get a side of mac n cheese after we had ordered and they guy gave it to us for free. Really nice place.

Informal.  I did takeout.  Everything was authentic and good.  Sides were subtle and light: cucumber salad, coleslaw, southern beans.  I had a pulled pork, Dixie chicken, and ribs combo with some brisket (no beans) chili.  Everything was very good, but chicken was fantastic, as was the chili.  Partner had brisket and loved it.  I highly recommend them.  Service was stupid fast.

This is surely one of the coolest place to eat in the region. Whenever I come to this place I am awfully satisfied. They manage their very high  standard service and the highest level of dishes  they give. You will be always satisfied with this place. Highly  recommended.

One of favorite BBQ places in area. Great friendly staff. Quick good quality food. Usually go with the pulled pork with sweet potatoes and corn bread. Food is fresh and good priced. Good fix for the BBQ cravings. They also sell beer. üëçüëçüëç

Tender, well-cooked ribs and pulled pork.  Cornbread is a little rubbery. Sides are okay. Brisket was tough. BBQ sauce was tasty enough from the dispensers, but the overall flavors of my pulled pork and ribs had traces of like, "carbon" in it?? I don't know. Regardless, it sated my cravings and I have a happy belly.
